subtitle.Text: I had seen Bikini Kill and Bratmobile play their first show at the North Shore Surf Club in Olympia - that was Valentine’s Day, 1991
and I was kind of blown away by the incredible rawness and the honesty that they wrote with and the kind of flippancy that they had I thought was really interesting,

but to have the opportunity to talk about all of these issues that are really important to young women I thought was really special, and I thought that what they were doing was taking the kind of intense, feminist ideas that had become popular in the '70s
with STSS and NOW, I mean those really incredible ideas and the ideology of feminism, but they were putting it into a language for today, for the 90’s I guess, I mean that was 20 years ago,
but it was for young people and it was to relate to topics about sexuality, about sex, about sexual abuse, about sexism and harassment
and all these things that are really important for young women - coming of age and becoming sexual beings that are really taboo to talk about.
